item.title: Linux Virtual Monitors with xrandr
item.description: I recently learned that you can configure virtual monitors with xrandr. There are two different ways to use this: treat multiple physical monitors as one giant virtual monitor or treat one physical monitor as multiple virtual monitors. Why do I want to do this? My primary interest here is to split a super widescreen monitor like the Dell 49” UltraSharp Curved Monitor (U4919DW) as multiple separate displays. I like the way that dwm breaks up monitors into multiple spaces and when I have two or three separate monitors I normally use a center monitor for focused work with the side monitors containing music, calendar, and chat.
